column4: anyone compiled their kernel, for the life of me I have all the correct settings for my hardware but this thing keeps doing a panic on install, I need someone to look at this .config I did and see if anyone can see the problem
lol
all I can think is that Ubuntu is setup that is needs [ ]  Power Management support  compiled in
that is./it ....
YEs of course and SO I can learn how this distro is working
I'm a hands on guy
hehe
but this is getting WAY out of hand here
no one in here has compiled their kernel?
I used to run gentoo
what 'restricted modules' are you using
ok I didnt install any so I need them for the k7 image?
I think you want this package linux-restricted-modules-2.6.10-5-k7
there wasnt any of them installed btw
actually linux-restricted-modules-k7 is a metapackage that will depend on the latest one
all I see it say is linux-restricted-modules-k7 2.6.10-7
I dont see any linux-restricted-modules-2.6.10-5-k7
do you have the restricted repo in your apt sources? I think it comes enabled by default. Updated from Warty or Hoary install
I found it doing apt-cache search, just couldnt seem to find it in Synaptic
ahh its under Misc Text based in Synaptic
forgot if I said thanks but that worked :-)
yep, glad I could help
